Jinnō Shōtōki. p. 228-231. ==Events of the Ninji Era== * 1242 (Ninji 3, 10th day of the 1st month): In the 10th year of Shijō's reign, the emperor died;Titsingh, p. 244; Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), 四條天皇 (87); retrieved 2012-5-16. and the succession (senso)Varley, p. 44; a distinct act of senso is unrecognized prior to Emperor Tenji; and all sovereigns except Jitō, Yōzei, Go-Toba, and Fushimi have senso and sokui in the same year until the reign of Emperor Go-Murakami. Compare Kunaichō, Ceremony of Accession (Sokui-no-Rei); retrieved 2012-5-22. was received by the second son of former Emperor Tsuchimikado.Titsingh, pp. 244-245; Varley, p. 228. * 1242 (Ninji 3, 5th month): Emperor Go-Saga's role as emperor was confirmed by ceremonies (sokui).Titsingh, p. 245; Varley, p. 44. * 14 July 1242 (Ninji 3, 15th day of the 6th month): Hōjō Yasutoki died at age 60.Titsingh, p. 246. * 7 October 1242 (Ninji 3, 12th day of the 9th month): Former Emperor Juntoku died in exile on Sado Island.Titsingh, p. 246; Kunaichō, 順徳天皇 (84); retrieved 2012-5-16. ==Related pages == * Kamakura period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Ninji 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 1240 1241 1242 1243 Preceded by: En'ō Era or nengō: Ninji Succeeded by: Kangen Category:Japanese eras Category:1240 Category:1241 Category:1242 Category:1243 Category:1240s in Japan
